meanings.definition: Make or become weaker in force, effect, or value.
meanings.sent1: The rain attenuating the power of the storm.
meanings.sent2: The medication is attenuating the pain in my knee.
meanings.sent3: Attenuating the spiciness of the chili with some sour cream.
meanings.sent4: Her smile attenuated the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement attenuated my fear of public speaking.

meanings.definition: Reduce the force, effect, or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The new law is attenuating the freedom of speech.
meanings.sent2: Overwatering can attenuate the growth of plants.
meanings.sent3: Attenuating the excitement of the surprise party by accidentally revealing it.
meanings.sent4: His absence attenuated the joy of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The fog attenuated the visibility on the road, causing accidents.

meanings.sent1: The bleach attenuated the color of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The constant use of hot tools can attenuate the strength of hair.
meanings.sent3: Attenuating the crowd by offering free samples at the store entrance.
meanings.sent4: The artist attenuated the bold lines with delicate shading.
meanings.sent5: The noise from the construction site attenuated as the workers took a break.
